Build ID: M20070921-1145

Steps To Reproduce:
I use Eclipse 3.3.1 with TPTP 4.4.0.3 on a Windows Server 2003 (Citrix). Agent Controller Version 4.4.0.0 runs on a SLES 9 Blade.
The problem is that I can't connect to the Agent Controller from eclipse. I perform the following steps.
1. Open a project in eclipse with sources that are running on the linux blade.
2. Rightclick on the project --> Profile As --> Open Profile Dialog
3. Create a new configuration for "Attach to Agent"
4. Then I add the linux blade as a new server with IP and port : 10006  --> Test connection is succesful
5. Afterwards I try to get the available agents. After clicking "refresh" eclipse searches but instead of showing the agent it gives the following message: "Error retrieving running agents - see log for more details"
6. The log shows the following information: 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui 4 4 2007-10-24 09:07:49.656
!MESSAGE Error: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller.null
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.AgentControllerUnavailableException: Error: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller.null
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.NodeImpl.connect(NodeImpl.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.AttachAgentTabProviders$DeferredAgentAdapter.fetchDeferredChildren(AttachAgentTabProviders.java:640)
	at org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$1.run(DeferredTreeContentManager.java:196)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
7. After that action the Agent Controller is stopped and I have to restart it. 

More information:

Please try to configure in step 4. port 10002 for the remote Agent Controller.
Currently, both ports 10002 and 10006 are used internally for connection with AC and 10002 should be configured in workbench for profiling use.

Hi Sebastian, 

The "Attach to Agent" mode assumes that you have external application with an agent connected to Agent Controller.
This view shows all agents registered by AC.
To use this mode you can start your application in command line with profiling options.

If you intend to profile code in the current eclipse workspace you can use "Java Application" mode instead of.

Ok perhaps I did a basic mistake, so I describe what I want to do.
I have a java application that is running on BEA WLS. This WLS runs on the SLES9 blade. The agent controller is installed on the same blade. Eclipse is started on windows and from there i want to profile the java application that is running on the wls. Is it wrong to use "Attach to Agent"?

I see :)
It seems you are right using attaching to agent.
Are you starting application/wls with profiling options in enabled/controlled mode?

Thank you for your help. I had the wrong parameters for profiling options. Now everything works fine.
